00010 #include "jcom.parameter.h"             // everything we need is in here
00011 
00012 // Globals
00013 t_class         *parameter_class;               // Required: Global pointer for our class
00014 t_class         *message_class;
00015 
00016 int param_list_compare(t_atom *x, long lengthx, t_atom *y, long lengthy);

00018 /************************************************************************************/
00019 // Class Definition
00020 
00021 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00022 {
00023         t_class         *c;
00024         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00025         long            offset;
00026         
00027         // Initialize Globals
00028         jamoma_init();
00029 
00030         // Define our class
00031         c = class_new(OBJECT_CLASS_NAME,(method)param_new, (method)param_free, 
00032                 (short)sizeof(t_param), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00033         offset = calcoffset(t_param, common);
00034         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00035                 
00036         // Make methods accessible for our class:
00037         // Note that we can't make the bang method directly accessible here (must go through another function)
00038         //      because the function pointer is in out struct, which hasn't been defined yet
00039         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dispatched,                            "dispatched",                                   A_GIMME,        0);
00040         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_int,                                           "int",                                                  A_DEFLONG,      0);
00041         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_float,                                         "float",                                                A_DEFFLOAT,     0);
00042         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_list,                                          "list",                                                 A_GIMME,        0);
00043         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_symbol,                                        "anything",                                             A_GIMME,        0);
00044 // TODO: Change this to line up with the NIME Paper.  For example:
00045 //              ramp/drive/parameter granularity 20.0   should be changed to...
00046 //              ramp/drive:/granularity 20.0
00047         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setRampFunctionParameter,      "ramp/function/parameter",              A_GIMME,        0);
00048         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getRampFunctionParameter,      "ramp/function/parameter/get",  A_GIMME,        0);
00049         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setRampDriveParameter,         "ramp/drive/parameter",                 A_GIMME,        0);
00050         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getRampDriveParameter,         "ramp/drive/parameter/get",             A_GIMME,        0);
00051         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_ui_refresh,                            "ui/refresh",                                   0);
00052         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_inc,                                           "value/inc",                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00053         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dec,                                           "value/dec",                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00054         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_inc,                                           "+",                                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dec,                                           "-",                                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dump,                                          "dump",                                                 0);
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_bang,                                          "bang",                                                 0);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_rampUpdate,                            "ramp/update",                                  0);
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_assist,                                        "assist",                                               A_CANT,         0); 
00060 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_reset,                                         "reset",                                                0);
00062 #endif
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setcallback,                           "setcallback",                                  A_CANT,         0);
00064 
00065         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(c, attr, offset, true);         // define a name attr
00066                 
00067         // ATTRIBUTE: ramp      
00068         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/drive", _sym_symbol,
00069                 (method)param_attr_setramp, (method)param_attr_getramp,
00070                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_ramp));
00071         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/function", _sym_symbol,
00072                 (method)param_attr_setrampfunction, (method)param_attr_getrampfunction,
00073                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_rampfunction));
00074 
00075         // ATTRIBUTE: type - options are msg_generic, msg_int, msg_float, msg_symbol, msg_toggle, msg_list, msg_none
00076         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "type", _sym_symbol,
00077                 (method)param_attr_settype, (method)param_attr_gettype,
00078                 calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_type));
00079         
00080         // ATTRIBUTE: ui/freeze - toggles a "frozen" ui outlet so that you can save cpu
00081         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ui/freeze", _sym_long,
00082                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getfreeze,
00083                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_ui_freeze));
00084         
00085         // ATTRIBUTE: stepsize - how much increment or decrement by
00086         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "value/stepsize", _sym_float32,
00087                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getstepsize,
00088                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_stepsize));
00089 
00090         // ATTRIBUTE: priority - used to determine order of parameter recall in a preset
00091         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "priority", _sym_long,
00092                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getpriority,
00093                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_priority));
00094 
00095         // ATTRIBUTE: value
00096         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "value", _sym_atom, LISTSIZE,
00097                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getvalue,
00098                 calcoffset(t_param, list_size), calcoffset(t_param, attr_value));
00099 
00100         // ATTRIBUTE: value/default
00101         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "value/default", _sym_atom, LISTSIZE,
00102                 (method)0, (method)0,
00103                 calcoffset(t_param, listDefault_size), calcoffset(t_param, attr_valueDefault));
00104 
00105         // ATTRIBUTE:
00106         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "dataspace", _sym_symbol,
00107                 (method)0, (method)0,
00108                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_dataspace));
00109         
00110         // ATTRIBUTE:
00111         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "unit/active", _sym_symbol,
00112                 (method)0, (method)0,
00113                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_unitActive));
00114 
00115         // ATTRIBUTE:
00116         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "unit/native", _sym_symbol,
00117                 (method)0, (method)0,
00118                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_unitNative));
00119 
00120         // Finalize our class
00121         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00122 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00123         message_class = c;
00124 #else
00125         parameter_class = c;
00126 #endif
00127         return 0;
00128 }

00131 /************************************************************************************/
00132 // Object Life
00133 #pragma mark -
00134 #pragma mark life cycle
00135 
00136 void *param_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00137 {
00138         short           i;
00139         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);
00140 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00141         t_param         *x = (t_param *)object_alloc(message_class);
00142 #else
00143         t_param         *x = (t_param *)object_alloc(parameter_class);
00144 #endif
00145         t_symbol        *name = _sym_nothing;
00146 
00147         if(attrstart && argv)
00148                 atom_arg_getsym(&name, 0, attrstart, argv);
00149         else
00150                 name = symbol_unique();
00151 
00152         if(x){
00153                 for(i=num_outlets; i > 0; i--)
00154                         x->outlets[i-1] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00155                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (t_object *)x->outlets[k_outlet_dumpout]);
00156                 
00157                 x->ui_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)param_ui_queuefn);
00158                 x->ramp_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)param_ramp_setup);
00159 
00160                 // set defaults...
00161                 x->attr_rampfunction = _sym_nothing;
00162                 x->attr_ramp = _sym_nothing;
00163                 x->ramper = NULL;
00164 
00165                 // defaulted to one long above, set list to be of size 1
00166                 x->list_size = 1;
00167                 x->listDefault_size = 0;
00168                 for(i = 0; i < LISTSIZE; i++){
00169                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_list[i], 0);
00170                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_listDefault[i], 0);
00171                 }
00172                 x->name = name;
00173                 atom_setsym(&x->name_atom, name);
00174                 x->attr_ui_freeze = 0;
00175                 x->attr_slavemode = 0;
00176                 x->attr_stepsize = 1.0;
00177                 x->attr_priority = 0;                                           // default is no priority
00178                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;                // set function pointer to default
00179                 x->attr_dataspace = ps_none;
00180                 x->attr_unitActive = ps_none;
00181                 x->attr_unitNative = ps_none;
00182                 
00183 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00184                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_message);
00185 #else
00186                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_parameter);
00187 #endif
00188                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                       // handle attribute args
00189 
00190 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00191                 param_reset(x); 
00192 #endif
00193                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00194                 
00195                 // If no type was specified by the user we call the accessor here
00196                 // this is important because memory is configured - not just setting a default!
00197                 if(x->common.attr_type == NULL){
00198                         t_atom a;
00199                         atom_setsym(&a, ps_msg_generic);
00200                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, ps_type, 1, &a);
00201                 }
00202                 if(x->attr_ramp == _sym_nothing){
00203                         t_atom a;
00204                         atom_setsym(&a, ps_none);
00205                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, gensym("ramp/drive"), 1, &a);
00206                 }
00207         }
00208         return (x);                                                                             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00209 }
00210 
00211 
00212 void param_free(t_param *x)
00213 {       
00214         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free((t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)x);
00215         qelem_free(x->ui_qelem);
00216         qelem_free(x->ramp_qelem);
00217         if(x->ramper)
00218                 delete x->ramper;
00219 }

00221 
00222 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00223 /************************************************************************************/
00224 // Communication with PSTO (pattrstorage)
00225 #pragma mark -
00226 #pragma mark pattr support
00227 
00228 // FROM psto
00229 t_max_err param_setvalueof(t_param *x, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00230 {
00231         if(argc && argv) {
00232                 sysmem_copyptr(argv, &x->atom_list[0], sizeof(t_atom) * argc);
00233                 x->list_size = argc;
00234                 x->param_output(x);
00235         }       
00236         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00237 }
00238 
00239 // TO psto
00240 t_max_err param_getvalueof(t_param *x, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00241 {
00242         if(argc && argv){
00243                 if(*argc && *argv) {
00244                         // use passed in memory
00245                 } 
00246                 else { 
00247                         if(x->list_size > 1)
00248                                 *argv = (t_atom *)getbytes(sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00249                         else
00250                                 *argv = (t_atom *)getbytes(sizeof(t_atom));
00251                 }
00252                 
00253                 *argc = x->list_size > 1 ? x->list_size : 1;
00254                 sysmem_copyptr(&x->atom_list[0], *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * (*argc));
00255         }
00256         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00257 }
00258 
00259 #endif
00260 
00261 
00262 /************************************************************************************/
00263 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00264 #pragma mark -
00265 #pragma mark attribute accessors
00266 
00267 
00268 // resets to default value
00269 void param_reset(t_param *x)
00270 {
00271         if(x->listDefault_size){                                                // copy the default values to the current value
00272                 sysmem_copyptr(x->atom_listDefault, x->atom_list, sizeof(t_atom) * x->listDefault_size);
00273                 x->list_size = x->listDefault_size;
00274         }
00275 }
00276 
00277 
00278 void param_setcallback(t_param *x, method newCallback, t_object *callbackArg)
00279 {
00280         x->callback = newCallback;
00281         x->callbackArg = callbackArg;
00282 }
00283 
00284 
00285 // ATTRIBUTE: TYPE
00286 // This is crucial because it sets function pointers for the optimized clipping, bang, and other functions
00287 t_max_err param_attr_settype(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00288 {
00289         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00290         x->common.attr_type = arg;
00291 
00292         if(arg == ps_msg_int){
00293                 x->param_output = &param_output_int;
00294         }
00295         else if(arg == ps_msg_float){
00296                 x->param_output = &param_output_float;
00297         }
00298         else if(arg == ps_msg_symbol){
00299                 x->param_output = &param_output_symbol;
00300         }
00301         else if(arg == ps_msg_toggle){
00302                 x->param_output = &param_output_int;
00303         }
00304         else if(arg == ps_msg_generic){
00305                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;
00306         } 
00307         else if(arg == ps_msg_list){
00308                 x->param_output = &param_output_list;
00309         }
00310 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00311         else if(arg == ps_msg_none){
00312                 x->param_output = &param_output_none;
00313         }
00314 #endif // JMOD_MESSAGE
00315         else{
00316 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00317                 error("Jamoma - invalid type specified for %s jcom.message in the %s module.", x->name->s_name, x->common.module_name->s_name);
00318 #else
00319                 error("Jamoma - invalid type specified for %s jcom.parameter in the %s module.", x->name->s_name, x->common.module_name->s_name);
00320 #endif
00321                 x->common.attr_type = ps_msg_generic;
00322                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;
00323         }
00324 
00325         qelem_set(x->ramp_qelem);       // set up the rampunit with callbacks appropriate to this data type
00326 
00327         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00328         #pragma unused(attr)
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 // ATTRIBUTE: RAMP
00333 // This is crucial because it sets function pointers
00334 t_max_err param_attr_setramp(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00335 {
00336         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00337         x->attr_ramp = arg;
00338         
00339         qelem_set(x->ramp_qelem);       // place a call to param_ramp_setup() at the end of the low-priority queue
00340 
00341         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00342         #pragma unused(attr)
00343 }
00344 
00345 t_max_err param_attr_getramp(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00346 {
00347         *argc = 1;
00348         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00349                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00350         atom_setsym(*argv, x->attr_ramp);
00351         
00352 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00353         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00354 }
00355 
00356 
00357 t_max_err param_attr_setrampfunction(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00358 {
00359         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00360         x->attr_rampfunction = arg;
00361 
00362         if(x->ramper)
00363                 x->ramper->setAttributeValue(TT("function"), TT(x->attr_rampfunction->s_name));
00364 
00365         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00366         #pragma unused(attr)
00367 }

00429 t_max_err param_attr_getvalue(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00430 {
00431         *argc = x->list_size;
00432         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00433                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00434         sysmem_copyptr(x->atom_list, *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00435 
00436 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00437         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00438 }

00440 
00441 void param_getRampFunctionParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00442 {
00443         TTSymbol        parameterName;
00444         TTValue         parameterValue;
00445         int numValues;
00446         t_atom          *a;
00447         TTSymbol        tempSymbol;
00448         double          tempValue;
00449         
00450         if(!argc){
00451                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to getParameter");
00452                 return;
00453         }
00454         
00455         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv)->s_name;
00456         //obj->function->getParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00457         obj->ramper->getFunctionParameterValue(parameterName, parameterValue);
00458         numValues = parameterValue.getNumValues();
00459         if(numValues) {
00460                 //atom_setsym(a+0, parameterName);
00461                 //atom_setfloat(a+1, av);
00462                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom)*(numValues+1));
00463                 // Forst list item is name of parameter
00464                 atom_setsym(a, gensym(parameterName));
00465                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00466                 for(int i=0; i<numValues; i++){
00467                         if(parameterValue.getType(i) == kTypeSymbol){
00468                                 parameterValue.get(i, tempSymbol);
00469                                 atom_setsym(a+i+1, gensym(tempSymbol));
00470                         }
00471                         else{
00472                                 parameterValue.get(i, tempValue);
00473                                 atom_setfloat(a+i+1, tempValue);
00474                         }
00475                 }
00476 
00477                 object_obex_dumpout(obj, gensym("ramp.function.getParameter"), numValues+1, a);
00478         
00479                 // The pointer to an atom assign in the getParameter method needs to be freed.
00480                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00481         }
00482 }
00483 
00484 
00485 void param_setRampFunctionParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00486 {
00487         TTSymbol        parameterName;
00488         TTValue         newValue;
00489         
00490         if(argc < 2){
00491                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to setParameter");
00492                 return;
00493         }
00494         
00495         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv)->s_name;
00496         for(int i=1; i<=(argc-1); i++){
00497                 if(argv[i].a_type == A_SYM)
00498                         newValue.append(TT(atom_getsym(argv+1)->s_name));
00499                 else
00500                         newValue.append(atom_getfloat(argv+i));
00501         }
00502         obj->ramper->setFunctionParameterValue(parameterName, newValue);        
00503         
00504 }
00505 
00506 
00507 void param_getRampDriveParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00508 {
00509         t_atom          *a;
00510         TTSymbol        parameterName;
00511         TTValue         parameterValue;
00512         int                     numValues;
00513         TTSymbol        tempSymbol;
00514         double          tempValue;
00515         
00516         if(!argc){
00517                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to getParameter");
00518                 return;
00519         }
00520         
00521         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv)->s_name;
00522         obj->ramper->getAttributeValue(parameterName, parameterValue);
00523         numValues = parameterValue.getNumValues();
00524         
00525         if(numValues){
00526                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom) * (numValues+1));
00527                 // First list item is name of parameter
00528                 atom_setsym(a, gensym(parameterName));
00529                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00530                 for(int i=0; i<numValues; i++){
00531                         if(parameterValue.getType(i) == kTypeSymbol){
00532                                 parameterValue.get(i, tempSymbol);
00533                                 atom_setsym(a+i+1, gensym(tempSymbol));
00534                         }
00535                         else{
00536                                 parameterValue.get(i, tempValue);
00537                                 atom_setfloat(a+i+1, tempValue);
00538                         }
00539                 }
00540                 object_obex_dumpout(obj, gensym("ramp.drive.getParameter"), numValues + 1, a);
00541                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00542         }
00543 }
00544 
00545 
00546 void param_setRampDriveParameter(t_param *obj, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00547 {
00548         TTSymbol        parameterName;
00549         TTValue         newValue;
00550         int                     i;
00551         
00552         if(argc < 2){
00553                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to setParameter");
00554                 return;
00555         }
00556 
00557         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv)->s_name;
00558         for(i=1; i<=(argc-1); i++){
00559                 if(argv[i].a_type == A_SYM)
00560                         newValue.append(TT(atom_getsym(argv+1)->s_name));
00561                 else
00562                         newValue.append(atom_getfloat(argv+i));
00563         }
00564 
00565         obj->ramper->setAttributeValue(parameterName, newValue);
00566 }
00567 
00568 
00569 /************************************************************************************/
00570 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00571 #pragma mark -
00572 #pragma mark methods
00573 
00574 // Method for Assistance Messages
00575 void param_assist(t_param *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00576 {
00577         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00578                 strcpy(dst, "input");
00579         else{                                                   // Outlets
00580                 switch(arg){
00581                         case k_outlet_set:
00582                                         strcpy(dst, "set: connect to ui object");
00583                                         break;
00584                         case k_outlet_direct:
00585                                         strcpy(dst, "direct: values");
00586                                         break;
00587                         case k_outlet_dumpout:
00588                                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00589                                         break;
00590                 }
00591         }               
00592 }
00593 
00594 
00595 // DUMP: use for debugging - dump state to the Max window
00596 void param_dump(t_param *x)
00597 {
00598         char    s[256];
00599         t_atom  a[4];
00600         
00601         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00602                 sprintf(s, "%s:clipmode", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00603                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00604                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_clipmode);
00605                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00606 
00607                 sprintf(s, "%s:description", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00608                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00609                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_description);
00610                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00611 
00612                 sprintf(s, "%s:priority", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00613                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00614                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->attr_priority);
00615                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00616 
00617                 sprintf(s, "%s:ramp", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00618                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00619                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->attr_ramp);
00620                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00621 
00622                 sprintf(s, "%s:range", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00623                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00624                 atom_setfloat(&a[1], x->common.attr_range[0]);
00625                 atom_setfloat(&a[2], x->common.attr_range[1]);
00626                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 3, a, NULL);
00627 
00628                 sprintf(s, "%s:repetitions", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00629                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00630                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->common.attr_repetitions);
00631                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00632 
00633                 sprintf(s, "%s:type", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00634                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00635                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_type);
00636                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00637 
00638                 sprintf(s, "%s:ui/freeze", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00639                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00640                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->attr_ui_freeze);
00641                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00642 
00643                 sprintf(s, "%s:value", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00644                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00645                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&a[1], &x->attr_value);
00646                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00647         }
00648 }
00649 
00650 
00651 // 'bang' method for user input
00652 void param_bang(t_param *x)
00653 {
00654 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00655         t_atom  a;
00656         
00657         atom_setsym(&a, gensym(""));
00658         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00659         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, 1, &a);
00660 
00661         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00662         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00663                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&a, &x->name_atom);
00664                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 1, &a, NULL);
00665         }
00666 #else
00667         x->param_output(x);
00668 #endif
00669         if(x->callback)
00670                 x->callback(x, x->name, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00671 }
00672 
00673 
00674 // Actual bang functions
00675 void param_output_generic(void *z)
00676 {
00677         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00678         
00679         if(x->list_size == 1){
00680                 param_clip_generic(x);
00681                 if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_LONG)
00682                         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00683                 else if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_FLOAT)
00684                         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_float);
00685                 else if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_SYM)
00686                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_sym, 0, NULL);
00687         }
00688         else if(x->list_size > 1){
00689                 param_clip_generic(x);
00690                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00691         } 
00692         else{   // zero args
00693                 param_output_none(x);
00694         }
00695         param_send_feedback(x);
00696 }
00697 
00698 
00699 void param_output_int(void *z)
00700 {
00701         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00702 
00703         param_clip_int(x);
00704         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00705         param_send_feedback(x);
00706 }
00707 
00708 
00709 void param_output_float(void *z)
00710 {
00711         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00712 
00713         param_clip_float(x);
00714         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_float);
00715         param_send_feedback(x);
00716 }
00717 
00718 
00719 void param_output_symbol(void *z)
00720 {
00721         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00722 
00723         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_sym, 0, NULL);
00724         param_send_feedback(x);
00725 }
00726 
00727 
00728 void param_output_list(void *z)
00729 {
00730         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00731         
00732         param_clip_list(x);
00733         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00734         param_send_feedback(x);
00735 }
00736 
00737 
00738 void param_output_none(void *z)
00739 {
00740         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00741         t_atom output[1];
00742         t_atom *out = (t_atom *)(&output);
00743 
00744         // bang direct output
00745         outlet_bang(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct]);
00746         
00747         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00748         // We can not use (method)param_send_feedback here as it assumes an additional argument
00749         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00750                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out, &x->name_atom);
00751                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 1, out, NULL);
00752         }
00753 }
00754 
00755 
00756 // INC & DEC
00757 void param_inc(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00758 {
00759         float   stepmult = 1.0;
00760         long    ramptime = 0;           // ms
00761         t_atom  a[3];                           // value, 'ramp', value
00762         short   a_len = 1;
00763         
00764         // Check for slave mode
00765         if(x->attr_slavemode) {
00766                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], ps_inc, 0, NULL);
00767                 return;
00768         }
00769         
00770         // Check for Arguments...
00771         if(argc){
00772                 // Look for arg to specify the number of steps to move
00773                 if(argv->a_type == A_FLOAT){
00774                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_float;
00775                         argc--;
00776                         argv++;
00777                 }
00778                 else if(argv->a_type == A_LONG){
00779                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_long;
00780                         argc--;
00781                         argv++;
00782                 }
00783                 
00784                 // Look for args to specify a ramp time
00785                 if(argc){
00786                         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00787                                 if(argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp){
00788                                         argc--;
00789                                         argv++;
00790                                         if(argc){
00791                                                 ramptime = atom_getlong(argv);
00792                                                 if(ramptime){
00793                                                         atom_setsym(a+1, ps_ramp);
00794                                                         atom_setlong(a+2, ramptime);
00795                                                         a_len = 3;
00796                                                 }
00797                                         }
00798                                 }
00799                         }
00800                 }
00801         }
00802         
00803         if(x->ramper)
00804                 x->ramper->stop();
00805                 
00806         if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int)
00807                 atom_setlong(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_long + (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00808         else if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
00809                 atom_setfloat(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_float + (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00810         else if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle){
00811                 if(x->attr_value.a_w.w_long == 1)
00812                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 0;
00813                 else
00814                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 1;
00815                 param_output_int(x);
00816                 return;
00817         }
00818         else{
00819                 error("%s parameter (in the %s module) is an inappropriate type for the 'inc' message.");
00820                 return;
00821         }
00822 
00823         param_dispatched(x, msg, a_len, a);
00824 }
00825 
00826 
00827 void param_dec(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00828 {
00829         float   stepmult = 1.0;
00830         long    ramptime = 0;           // ms
00831         t_atom  a[3];                           // value, 'ramp', value
00832         short   a_len = 1;
00833 
00834         // Check for slave mode
00835         if(x->attr_slavemode) {
00836                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], ps_dec, 0, NULL);
00837                 return;
00838         }
00839         
00840         // Check for Arguments...
00841         if(argc){
00842                 // Look for arg to specify the number of steps to move
00843                 if(argv->a_type == A_FLOAT){
00844                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_float;
00845                         argc--;
00846                         argv++;
00847                 }
00848                 else if(argv->a_type == A_LONG){
00849                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_long;
00850                         argc--;
00851                         argv++;
00852                 }
00853                 
00854                 // Look for args to specify a ramp time
00855                 if(argc){
00856                         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00857                                 if(argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp){
00858                                         argc--;
00859                                         argv++;
00860                                         if(argc){
00861                                                 ramptime = atom_getlong(argv);
00862                                                 if(ramptime){
00863                                                         atom_setsym(a+1, ps_ramp);
00864                                                         atom_setlong(a+2, ramptime);
00865                                                         a_len = 3;
00866                                                 }
00867                                         }
00868                                 }
00869                         }
00870                 }
00871         }
00872 
00873         // new input - halt any ramping...
00874         if(x->ramper)
00875                 x->ramper->stop();
00876                 
00877         if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int)
00878                 atom_setlong(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_long - (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00879         else if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
00880                 atom_setfloat(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_float - (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00881         else if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle){
00882                 if(x->attr_value.a_w.w_long == 1)
00883                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 0;
00884                 else
00885                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 1;
00886                 param_output_int(x);
00887                 return;
00888         }
00889         else{
00890                 error("%s parameter (in the %s module) is an inappropriate type for the 'dec' message.");
00891                 return;
00892         }
00893 
00894         param_dispatched(x, msg, a_len, a);
00895 }
00896 
00897 
00898 // /ramp/update INPUT
00899 
00900 void param_rampUpdate(t_param *x)
00901 {
00902         //post("Requested to update.");
00903         
00904         x->ramper->tick();
00905 }
00906 
00907 
00908 // INT INPUT
00909 void param_int(t_param *x, long value)
00910 {
00911         // Check for slave mode
00912         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00913                 outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], value);
00914                 return;
00915         }
00916         x->list_size = 1;
00917         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00918                 if(value == atom_getlong(&x->attr_value))
00919                         return;
00920         }
00921         // new input - halt any ramping...
00922         if(x->ramper)
00923                 x->ramper->stop();
00924         atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, value);
00925         x->param_output(x);
00926 }
00927 
00928 
00929 // FLOAT INPUT
00930 void param_float(t_param *x, double value)
00931 {
00932         // Check for slave mode
00933         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00934                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], value);
00935                 return;
00936         }
00937         
00938         x->list_size = 1;
00939         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00940                 if(value == atom_getfloat(&x->attr_value))
00941                         return;
00942         }
00943         // new input - halt any ramping...
00944         if(x->ramper)
00945                 x->ramper->stop();
00946 
00947         atom_setfloat(&x->attr_value, value);
00948         x->param_output(x);
00949 }
00950 
00951 
00952 // SYMBOL INPUT
00953 void param_symbol(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00954 {
00955         // Check for slave mode
00956         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00957                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], msg, argc, argv);
00958                 return;
00959         }
00960         
00961         x->list_size = 1;
00962         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00963                 if(jcom_core_atom_compare(x->common.attr_type, &x->attr_value, argv))
00964                         return;
00965         }
00966         atom_setsym(&x->attr_value, msg);
00967         x->param_output(x);
00968 
00969 }
00970 
00971 
00972 void param_ui_refresh(t_param *x)
00973 {
00974         if (!x->attr_slavemode)
00975                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, x->list_size, &x->attr_value);
00976 }
00977 
00978 
00979 // Send feedback to the hub
00980 void param_send_feedback(t_param *x)
00981 {
00982         t_atom output[LISTSIZE + 1];
00983         t_atom *out = (t_atom *)(&output);
00984         
00985         // send to our ui outlet
00986         if(x->attr_ui_freeze == 0)
00987                 qelem_set(x->ui_qelem);
00988 
00989         // send to the object in which this parameter is embedded
00990         if(x->callback)
00991                 x->callback(x->callbackArg, x->name, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00992         
00993         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00994         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00995                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out, &x->name_atom);
00996                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out+1, &x->attr_value);
00997                 // copy any remaining atoms
00998                 if(x->list_size > 1) 
00999                         sysmem_copyptr(&x->atom_list[1], out + 2, sizeof(t_atom) * (x->list_size - 1));
01000                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, x->list_size + 1, out, NULL);
01001         }
01002         // notify listeners (pattr or jcom.paramui) that we have modified data
01003 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
01004         object_notify(x, _sym_modified, NULL);
01005 #endif
01006 }
01007 
01008 
01009 // Send values to a potentially connected ui object at the first outlet
01010 void param_ui_queuefn(t_param *x)
01011 {
01012         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, x->list_size, &x->attr_value);
01013 }
01014 
01015 
01016 // messages received from jcom.hub
01017 void param_dispatched(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
01018 {
01019         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
01020                 if (argc==0)
01021                         outlet_bang(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct]);
01022                 else if (argc==1) {             
01023                         switch(argv[0].a_type) 
01024                                 {
01025                                         case A_LONG:
01026                                                 outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getlong(argv));
01027                                                 break;
01028                                         case A_FLOAT:
01029                                                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getfloat(argv));
01030                                                 break;
01031                                         case A_SYM:
01032                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getsym(argv), 0, 0L);
01033                                                 break;
01034                                         default:
01035                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], msg, argc, argv);
01036                                                 break;
01037                                 }
01038                 }
01039                 else
01040                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, argc, argv);
01041         }
01042         else {
01043                         // new input - halt any ramping...
01044                         if(x->ramper)
01045                                 x->ramper->stop();
01046                 
01047                         if(argc == 1 ){
01048                                 // If repetitions are disabled, we check for a repetition by treating
01049                                 // this as a 1 element list
01050                                 if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0 && param_list_compare(x->atom_list, 
01051                                         x->list_size, argv, argc)) 
01052                                         return;
01053 
01054                                 x->list_size = 1;                               
01055                                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->attr_value, argv);
01056                                 x->param_output(x);
01057                         } else if(argc > 1) {
01058                                 param_list(x, msg, argc, argv);
01059                         }
01060                         else {  // no args
01061 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
01062                                 // generic parameters may have no arg -- i.e. to open a dialog that defines the arg
01063                                 if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic)
01064                                         x->list_size = 0;
01065 #endif                  
01066                                 x->param_output(x);
01067                         }
01068                 }
01069 }
01070 
01071 // Returns true if lists are identical
01072 int param_list_compare(t_atom *x, long lengthx, t_atom *y, long lengthy)
01073 {
01074         // If lists differ in length they're obviously not the same
01075         if(lengthx == lengthy) {
01076                 short type;
01077                 for(int i = 0; i < lengthx; i++) {
01078                         if((x->a_type) != (y->a_type))
01079                                 return 0; // not identical, types differ
01080                         
01081                         type = x->a_type;
01082                         if((type == A_FLOAT) && (x->a_w.w_float != y->a_w.w_float))
01083                                 return 0;
01084                         else if((type == A_LONG) && (x->a_w.w_long != y->a_w.w_long))
01085                                 return 0;
01086                         else if((type == A_SYM) && (x->a_w.w_sym != y->a_w.w_sym))
01087                                 return 0;
01088                         
01089                         x++; y++;  // keep going
01090                 }
01091         } 
01092         else {
01093                 return 0; // list lengths differ
01094         }
01095         
01096         return 1;
01097 }
01098 
01099 // LIST INPUT <value, ramptime>
01100 void param_list(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
01101 {
01102         double  start[LISTSIZE], values[LISTSIZE], time;
01103         int i;
01104         
01105         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
01106                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, argc, argv);
01107                 return;
01108         }
01109                 
01110         // Check the second to last item in the list first, which when ramping should == the string ramp
01111         t_atom* ramp = argv + (argc - 2);
01112         if (ramp->a_type == A_SYM && ramp->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp) {
01113 
01114                 time = atom_getfloat(argv+(argc-1));
01115 
01116                 // Only one list member if @type is msg_int of msg_float
01117                 if ( x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int || x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float)
01118                         argc = 1;
01119                 else
01120                         argc = argc - 2;
01121                 
01122                 for (i=0; i<argc; i++) {
01123                         values[i] = atom_getfloat(argv+i);
01124                         if (i<=x->list_size)
01125                                 start[i] = atom_getfloat(&x->atom_list[i]);
01126                         else
01127                                 start[i] = atom_getfloat(&x->atom_list[(x->list_size)-1]);
01128                 }
01129 
01130                 if(time <= 0){
01131                         jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->attr_value, argv);
01132                         x->param_output(x);
01133                         return;
01134                 }       
01135 
01136                 if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
01137                         if(param_list_compare(x->atom_list, x->list_size, argv, argc))
01138                                 return; // nothing to do
01139                 }
01140 
01141                 x->list_size = argc;
01142                 x->ramper->set(argc, start);
01143                 x->ramper->go(argc, values, time);
01144         } 
01145         else {
01146                 // Don't output if the input data is identical
01147                 if(!x->common.attr_repetitions) {
01148                         if(param_list_compare(x->atom_list, x->list_size, argv, argc))
01149                                 return; // nothing to do
01150                 }
01151                 
01152                 // Avoid copying more than one atom if the type only can have one argument
01153                 if(x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_list && x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_generic
01154                         && x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_none) {
01155                         // If attr_type is != to anyone of the above values then we know 
01156                         // that it must be == to a scalar type.  This ensures it will behave
01157                         // as a scalar and not a list.
01158                         argc = 1;
01159                 }
01160                         
01161                 for(i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
01162                         switch(argv[i].a_type) 
01163                         {
01164                                 case A_LONG:
01165                                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getlong(argv + i));
01166                                         break;
01167                                 case A_FLOAT:
01168                                         atom_setfloat(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getfloat(argv + i));
01169                                         break;
01170                                 case A_SYM:
01171                                         atom_setsym(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getsym(argv + i));
01172                                         break;
01173                                 default:
01174                                         error("param_list: no type specification");
01175                                         break;
01176                         }
01177                 }
01178                 x->list_size = argc;
01179                 x->param_output(x);
01180         }
01181 }
01182 
01183 
01184 #pragma mark -
01185 #pragma mark Ramp Units
01186 
01187 void param_ramp_callback_float(void *v, short, double *value)
01188 {
01189         t_param *x = (t_param *)v;
01190         float   oldval = atom_getfloat(&x->attr_value);
01191         
01192         if(x->common.attr_repetitions || *value != oldval){
01193                 atom_setfloat(&x->attr_value, *value);
01194                 param_output_float(x);
01195         }
01196 }
01197 
01198 
01199 void param_ramp_callback_int(void *v, short, double *value)
01200 {
01201         t_param *x= (t_param *)v;
01202         long    val     = *value;
01203         long    oldval;
01204 
01205         oldval = atom_getlong(&x->attr_value);
01206         if (x->common.attr_repetitions || val != oldval){
01207                 atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, val);
01208                 param_output_int(x);
01209         }
01210 }
01211 
01212 
01213 void param_ramp_callback_list(void *v, short argc, double *value)
01214 {
01215         long i;
01216         t_param *x = (t_param *)v;
01217         
01218         // we won't bother about avoiding repetitions for list, so never mind oldval
01219 
01220         for (i=0; i<argc; i++)
01221                 atom_setfloat(&x->atom_list[i], value[i]);
01222         param_output_list(x);   
01223 }
01224 
01225 
01226 void param_ramp_setup(t_param *x)
01227 {
01228         // 1. destroy the old rampunit
01229         if(x->ramper != NULL) {
01230                 delete x->ramper;
01231                 x->ramper = NULL;
01232         }
01233                 
01234         // 2. create the new rampunit
01235         // For some types ramping doesn't make sense, so they will be set to none
01236         if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_none) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_symbol) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
01237                 x->attr_ramp = gensym("none");
01238                 
01239                 
01240         if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle))
01241                 RampLib::createUnit(TT(x->attr_ramp->s_name), &x->ramper, param_ramp_callback_int, (void *)x);
01242         else if (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_list)
01243                 RampLib::createUnit(TT(x->attr_ramp->s_name), &x->ramper, param_ramp_callback_list, (void *)x);
01244         else
01245                 RampLib::createUnit(TT(x->attr_ramp->s_name), &x->ramper, param_ramp_callback_float, (void *)x);
01246 
01247         if(x->ramper == NULL)
01248                 error("jcom.parameter (%s module): could not allocate memory for ramp unit!", x->common.module_name);
01249                 
01250         if(x->attr_rampfunction && x->attr_rampfunction != _sym_nothing && x->attr_rampfunction != gensym("linear"))
01251                 object_attr_setsym(x, gensym("ramp/function"), x->attr_rampfunction);
01252 }
